mean_cn: n. 妥协，折中；  v. 妥协，使遭受危害
mean_en: a way of reaching an agreement in which each person or group gives up something that was wanted in order to end an argument or dispute
word_etyma: com共同 + promise承诺 → compromise 妥协，和解
short_phrase: The red man makes them compromise.
sentence: The seller made a compromise and sold the dress at 50 yuan.
sentence_trans: 商家做出了妥协，50元卖出了那条裙子。
